___other-processes.description: Could the command modify other processes? Examples: `kill`, `disown`.

___filesystem.description: Could the command modify the filesystem? Examples: `rm`, `mv`.

___invocations.description: The possible forms a command can have. All invocations must have the same component commands. There must be at least one invocation.

___command-requirements-as-invoked.description: Requirements for a component command as its used in the invocation.

___sudo.description: As used in this invocation, does the command require superuser priveleges?

___version-specifier.description: For this invocation, what version is required?

___authentication.description: As used in this invocation, does the command require the user to enter their password?

___internet-connection.description: As used in this invocation, does the command require an active internet connection?

___sha1s-tested.description: For this invocation, what are some sha1sums of the binaries for the component command that are known to work?

___versions-tested.description: What versions is this invocation known to work for?

___changeable-arguments.description: Adjustable parameters of the command or commands.

additionalProperties.description: The actual text of the argument; a subset of the invocation string.

___type.description: The base type of the argument. Useful since e.g. JSON does not distinguish floats and integers.

___invocation-slice.description: Position of the argument in the invocation string that can be accessed by slice notation.

___component-command.description: The argument is passed to this command.

___subtype.description: More refined type, e.g. type is string, subtype is absolute path.

___component-command-flag.description: The argument is passed via this flag.

___invocation-string.description: Actual string that could be passed to the shell and executed. Required field.

___comment.description: Explanation of what makes this invocation different from others.

___shell-compatibility.description: Explains which shells are/aren't compatible with this invocation.

___compatible-version-specifier.description: Specify the version(s) that the shell is compatible with for this invocation. Expected to be human-readable, not machine-readable.

___incompatible-versions-tested.description: List of versions for the shell that are known to fail or not work as expected for this invocation.

___compatible-sha1s-tested.description: List of SHA1 hashes for the binary executable of the shell that are known to work with this invocation.

___compatible-versions-tested.description: List of versions for the shell that are known to work with this invocation.

___incompatible-sha1s-tested.description: List of SHA1 hashes for the binary executable of the shell that are known to fail or not work as expected with this invocation.

___incompatible-version-specifier.description: Specify the version(s) that the shell is not compatible with for this invocation. Expected to be human-readable, not machine-readable.

___example-outputs.description: Example outputs of the command. Only include these if they are is short and provide insight into what the command does.

___description.description: Textual description of what the command does. Required field.

___verbose-description.description: The full text of the description. Don't add hard linebreaks; let the output formatter decide how to do that. Required field.

___terse-description.description: Description text that is 80 characters or less.

___related-commands.description: UUIDs of other commands that are related to this one. For example, a command that accomplishes the same thing with different component commands.

___uuid.description: Universally unique identifier of related command.
Universally Unique Identifier for this CmdOyster.

___license-name.description: Usually a free software license, such as GPL, BSD, or MIT.

___year.description: Year the CmdOyster was first written.

___authors.description: List of the people who wrote the CmdOyster, not necessarily the command itself.

___license-url.description: Link to the text of the license, usually HTTP.

___relevant-urls.description: A list of URLs that discuss the command or an equivalent command with the same component commands.

___date-known-good.description: Date when the link to the page worked. Useful if the page changes or link is broken and searching for an archival copy.

___component-commands.description: List of the individual commands that make up the composite command. Required field.

___component-command-info.description: Additional metadata for the component commands.

___bash-type.description: The output of `type -t $COMMAND` in bash; one of `alias`, `keyword`, `function`, `builtin`, or `file`. May be different in other shells, e.g. `which` is a `builtin` in zsh but a `file` in bash.

___debian.description: Information specific to the Debian Linux distribution.

___executable-path.description: The full path to the binary. Often in e.g. `/bin/` or `/usr/bin/`.

___required-packages.description: the Debian package(s) required to install the relevant command.

___requirements-in-general.description: Requirements for a command in all possible uses. Useful for figuring out why a command doesn't work as expected.

___sudo.description: Could the command require superuser priveleges? Examples: `shutdown`, `rtcwake`.

___authentication.description: Could the command require the user to enter their password? Examples: `chsh`, `passwd`.

___internet-connection.description: Could the command require an active internet connection? Examples: `wget`, `whois`, `dig`.
